reviews.review_msg: the selection of books are still fine but his teaching is terrible and unbearable. Super boring for a night class. He does not seem to like his job or even the topic he is teaching.
i dropped this course because she is just so disrespectful toward students .

One of the best english teachers in my entire life!!! Her teaching is pretty attractive and never get boring. She is always kind to any students who ask question even in not fluent english. It's my pleasure being her student in this institute.

He really cares about his students. His feedback is good and I think is really cool that he gives more group activities than other courses but also gives the choice to work on your own if you want to do it by yourself. I would definitely take this class again.
Jason is very caring. He gives good feedback and participation matters a lot in this class.

I took it for a requirement, skipped some lectures here and there and thankfully didn't miss much. Her readings are nice, you could make it easier for you by reading summaries before attending class. Always, always, always, know what the TA is looking for when grading, your grade is in the TA's hands. Test is decent and very fair.

Great professor, but the reading part is quite tedious. I read a few pages of the first book and got bored already. Fortunately you could totally get by reading only plot summaries and analysis. I only read 4 of the short stories in the form of audiobooks during commute and none of the longer books. Wouldn't take this if it's not a requirement tho.

Such a kind prof! I very much enjoyed her class, despite English being one of my worst subjects. She was very engaging and you could tell that she cared a lot about her students. The books read for the semester were very interesting and I learned a lot about life and myself in this class.

Lectures are asynchronous and given in a podcast format every week. Weekly short stories aren't too long and weekly podcast lectures are not long either. Lectures are amazing in the way the prof explains everything going on in the story with detail and good reasoning. The reading journals and final essay aren't too bad as long as you pay attention.

Colette Colligan runs a completely asynchronous podcast-style course which makes it convenient to listen to her lectures while completing other tasks. Her reading list is engaging and varied. She only assigns 1-2 short stories per week, ranging from 1-25 pages so far. There are very few written assignments for a "W" course. I absolutely recommend!

very interesting person with lots to share. Passionate about the topics and books. Doesn't really show that he cares about the students but he is actually really willing to help. Lectures are structured interesting and interactively. His lectures are 10/10. However, can be a tough marker.

Amazing Prof, he's strict about technology so don't go on your phone or computer. There is only 2 essays and a final so try hard for those. Explains very well and is very enthusiastic about course material. The final exam is open book and you can bring your notebook so be sure to attend classes and take notes! (TA's do all the grading)

She clearly cares about her students because they do mindfulness at the very beginning of Wednesdays lecture. In our final, she had cough drops and tissue at the front of the room in case anybody needed them. She also asked us if we wanted to practice mindfulness before our final. Lectures are engaging and the workload was realistic.

Nicky's lectures are largely based on class discussion and interpreting readings (including graphic novels) about games/gaming. You don't have to participate but she will wait until someone says something. Assignments are fair and instructions are very thorough. My TA provides good feedback and helpful tutorials.

She was a good, caring, and respectful prof. However, I found the TAs marked hard. Our first essay was worth 50% which was tough not knowing what to expect in terms of grading. Lectures were pointless at times. We had to read a few novels (as expected). Pretty easy class but marked on only a handful of things so if you screw up, it'll weigh a lot.

Dr. Collis is an amazing prof! I've never considered myself to be strong with writing, going back to high school, yet I managed to get a good grade in this course. He is helpful with responding to our concerns in understanding the poems read in class, and gives fun lectures.

The marking criteria is not clear. Whatever the professor and TA's say to do for the assignments are contradicted in their marking and feedback. They mark very hard, and you are constantly trying to impress them and read their mind. We don't learn anything, and have to figure out the poems by ourselves and whatever we interpret is always wrong.
Dr. Collis is a real gem! I was a bit iffy about which english class/prof to go with, but he is very caring towards all students. Marking is fair and I've gained a real appreciation for poetry.
the prof is chill but if your TA is Ziwei then drop this class she is such a hard marker for no reason. even if your work is perfect she will have something negative to say

i never really got to know the prof since this was a blended learning course. all of her lectures were recorded but she seemed nice enough! your mark depends entirely on the TA (i only interacted with them) so make sure to ask questions during tutorial and ask for feedback. participate in tutorial! lots of reading. [spring 2022]

She is an amazing professor. She goes in depth of the lecture material and beyond what is on her slides. She's always open for discussion and is extremely kind. Her love and passion for her job make an amazing professor. Engl112 was a great course because she was super engaging and helpful
